title: Manchester United transfer news RECAP
body_text:
Manchester United are progressing with a potential loan move for Burnley striker Wout Weghorst, who is currently on loan with Turkish side Besiktas.
The Reds are looking to recruit a new striker this month following the departure of Cristiano Ronaldo in November, with Erik ten Hag keen to add cover for Anthony Martial. The Frenchman has been impressive this term and registered seven goal contributions, but he has already missed 15 matches through injury.
The Manchester Evening News understands that United are keen on a move for Netherlands forward Weghorst. The 30-year-old has scored eight goals in 16 games for his loan club this term and is aligned with Ten Hag's transfer strategy of favouring players familiar to him or schooled in his homeland.
Meanwhile, reports are suggesting that Atletico Madrid are demanding a £9.5million loan fee and a commitment to buy at £70.5m for Joao Felix in January. The Portugal international has fallen out with manager Diego Simeone and the club are happy for him to leave this month. The Reds are thought to be keen on the player, but are unlikely to pay a substantial loan fee for any attacker.
TODAY'S BIG TALKING POINT: Would Weghorst be a good signing? Have your say here .
Follow throughout the day for the latest United news.
Key Events
Goodnight all!
Thanks for following along with us for today's United transfer blog!
Check in tomorrow morning as we keep you up to speed with all the news, views and gossip from Old Trafford during the January transfer window.

Mohammed Kudus 'would love move' to Old Trafford
Mohammed Kudus "would love" the chance to move to United, according to journalist Pete O'Rourke.
The Ajax ace has been heavily linked with a move to Old Trafford, with the midfielder having impressed for Ghana at the World Cup in Qatar.
As per Give Me Sport, O'Rourke said: "Yeah, I think a club like Manchester United comes calling for you, you’re going to have to be interested in it. I’m sure Kudus would love that opportunity to join one of the world’s biggest clubs, he wants to play on the biggest stage possible.
"He showed he can rise to the occasion as he has done for Ajax in the Champions League this season as well as Ghana at the World Cup when he was arguably their best player."
Fernandes pokes fun at De Gea over appearances
David De Gea is now outright 10th on United's all-time appearances list, having moved ahead of Joe Spence on 511 matches with his start in the FA Cup win over Everton.
The Spaniard joins an illustrious group of Reds legends - but his teammate Bruno Fernandes was still keen to have a joke with the shot-stopper.

Gary Neville slams 'strange' new 'Ronaldo rule' with Casemiro point
Recent reports have hinted that United are planning to introduce a so-called 'Ronaldo rule' in a bid to stop any members of the squad becoming jealous of their teammates' wages.
The rule would see all salaries limited at £200k per week, regardless of seniority.
And it is safe to say that the news did not go down well with Neville.
Click here to find out what the former United man had to say about it >>>
United laugh off Harry Maguire transfer speculation
The MEN have heard from sources close to Maguire and United that any speculation linking the defender with a move away from the club is 'laughable' after reports emerged earlier tonight regarding a possible move to Aston Villa.
Click here to read the full story from our chief United writer Samuel Luckhurst >>>
Report: Wout Weghorst representatives fly to Turkey to force through United move
According to the Express, Weghorst's representatives are flying to Istanbul to hold 'face-to-face talks' with Besiktas in an attempt to try and 'unlock' a dream move to Old Trafford for the Dutch international.
The MEN reported yesterday that United were advancing with a potential loan deal for Weghorst and now it appears that move may have just gone one step closer.
United's next six fixtures
With United's FA Cup tie against Reading confirmed and the Premier League's decision to rearrange the Crystal Palace at late notice, Erik ten Hag has a clear picture of what the club's fixture schedule looks like for the next month or so:
- Charlton Athletic (H) - Carabao Cup Q/F - January 10
- Manchester City (H) - Premier League - January 14
Crystal Palace (H) - Premier League - January 18
- Arsenal (A) - Premier League - January 22
- Reading (H) - FA Cup - Weekend of January 28
- Leeds United (A) - Premier League - February 12
Report: Aston Villa 'on the verge' of signing Harry Maguire
The club captain could be on his way out of Old Trafford during the January transfer window according to the latest reports...
New date announced for Crystal Palace vs United
A statement from the Premier League read:
"After the results of this weekend’s FA Cup third-round ties, a new date for the postponed Premier League match between Crystal Palace and Manchester United at Selhurst Park can now be confirmed.
"The Palace v Man Utd match will take place on Wednesday 18 January, 20:00 GMT kick-off.
"The Premier League apologises for the late notice in confirming this fixture and understands supporters’ frustrations.
"While the League endeavours to give greater notice for rescheduling, the unique circumstances around these fixtures mean we were unable to. "
Wout Weghorst breaks silence after 'goodbye' celebration
The MEN reported on Saturday that United are advancing with a potential loan move for Weghorst.
The 6ft 6in (1.97m) forward netted in his side's Super Lig match against Kasimpasa AS and proceeded to wave to the crowd, before seemingly mouthing 'bye-bye' in what appeared to be a final farewell.
And now Weghorst has taken to social media to send a message to Besiktas fans after his celebration.
United vs Reading in the fourth round of the FA Cup
United will take on Reading in the FA Cup fourth round.
The tie will take place at Old Trafford across the weekend of Friday 27 January-Monday 30 January
Happy with the draw, Reds?
FA Cup draw LIVE
We are moments away from the FA Cup draw for the fourth round of the competition.
Follow along with our live blog to find out who United will face in the next round following their 3-1 win over Everton at Old Trafford on Friday.
Ball number 30 is the one to keep your eye on...
Click here to join Dan B over on our dedicated live blog as he provides all the latest updates >>>
Atletico Madrid issue fresh Joao Felix update
Atletico president Enrique Cerezo has given another update over the future of Felix.
The 23-year-old has been heavily linked with a move to Old Trafford in the January transfer window.
The La Liga club's apparent demand for a sizeable loan fee and obligation to buy have proved to be a stumbling block so far.
Click here to find out the latest update from the Atletico president himself >>>
FA Cup draw simulated
The draw for the fourth-round of the FA Cup will take place in just over an hour's time, meaning United will soon find out who they will be tasked with trying to get the better of next.
The Reds defeated Everton 3-1 at Old Trafford on Friday night, marking the beginning, hopefully, of a strong run in the competition.
Ahead of the real draw taking place, MEN Sport has done a simulated version.
Weghorst's agent addresses Besiktas 'farewell'
Wout Weghorst's agent, Simon Cziommer, has played down the striker's apparent farewell to Besiktas' supporters following their 2-1 win over Kasimpasa on Saturday.
United are interested in signing the striker on loan for the remainder of the season. He is currently on loan at Besiktas from Burnley.
Weghorst appeared to be waving and bidding farewell to the Turkish giants' fans following the full-time whistle, but Cziommer has rubbished those suggestions.
He said:
"Everything is fine. There is no problem. Wout just made a celebration."
Blackpool 'eye' Ramsay
According to The Sun journalist Alan Nixon, Blackpool are 'taking a look' at United set-piece coach Eric Ramsay as a possible contender to become their new manager.
The Tangerines, who beat Nottingham Forest 4-1 in the FA Cup yesterday, are currently 22nd in the Championship table and in danger of suffering relegation to League One.
Boss Michael Appleton is under mounting pressure and it is claimed that Blackpool are looking at Ramsay as a possible replacement.
FULL STORY: Besiktas issue Weghorst update
Besiktas sporting director Ceyhun Kazanci has played down fears of losing Wout Weghorst to United in this month's transfer window.
Weghorst, as reported by the Manchester Evening News, is the subject of interest from United, who want to sign him on loan for the remainder of the season. The Netherlands international is currently on loan at Besiktas from Championship club Burnley.
Al-Nassr 'terminate' Aboubakar's contract amid United links
Saudi Arabian club Al Nassr have reportedly terminated Vincent Aboubakar's contract to make way for new signing Cristiano Ronaldo.
That is according to a report by RMC Sport, who claim that the Saudi giants have had to make such a decision in the aftermath of signing the former United man.
Interestingly, Aboubakar, in the last few days, has been linked with a shock move to Old Trafford.
United drop FFP hint about transfer plans
United football director John Murtough has once again hinted that the club expect to have a quiet January transfer window, pointing towards the importance of remaining with Financial Fair Play guidlines.
United invested heavily in the squad during the summer, splashing out more than £200million on six new recruits. It means they are expected to ease off the gas this month.
They want to sign a striker and are expected to bring one in on loan, possibly Wout Weghorst.
Ten Hag taking a risk to make United a force again
United manager Erik ten Hag has admitted that his disciplinary methods are a necessary risk to try and make the club great again.
The Dutchman has overseen a period of progression since taking charge during the summer. They are currently on a run of seven wins in a row and are just one win away from reaching the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup.
Besiktas director issues Weghorst update amid United interest
Besiktas sporting director Ceyhun Kazanci has issued an update on striker Wout Weghorst's future amid United's interest in signing him on loan.
United are progressing with a deal to sign the Dutchman on loan for the remainder of the season from Burnley. Weghorst joined Besiktas on loan from Burnley during the summer, following the Clarets' relegation to the Championship.
Kazanci, as quoted by Fanatik, said:
"I don't understand why Weghorst said goodbye to the fans, why he made such a move. He is our football player right now. Our contract expires at the end of the season. If Manchester United or any other team wants Weghorst, they will meet with Burnley anyway.
"Burnley will then contact us and discuss the terms of separation. If we accept, the contract will be terminated. Otherwise, it will go on until the end of the season. He can't just go. There will have to be a reward for us to approve the separation. I'll give an example. Burnley told us, 'We made a deal with this team for Weghorst. We give you half of the transfer fee'. This may be a different condition. Then we'll sit down and talk."
Arsenal 'close' to landing Felix
Arsenal are 'close' to signing United-linked striker Joao Felix on loan from Atletico Madrid, according to reports.
The Portuguese international has been closely linked with a move to both United and Arsenal in recent weeks, with both clubs determined to strengthen their attacking options this month. It is claimed that the Gunners are now closing in on a loan deal to secure his signature.
It is claimed that Arsenal will pay Atletico £19million in a loan fee.
United 'interested' in Abraham swoop
According to a report by La Repubblica, via RomaPress, United, along with Arsenal, are 'interested' in signing Roma striker Tammy Abraham.
The England internartional has been heavily linked with a return to England in recent months following an impressive time in Italy since joining Roma from Chelsea in August 2021. He has scored 31 goals in 74 appearance for the Italian giants so far.
Atletico 'interested' in Garnacho return
According to a report by Fichajes, Atletico Madrid are 'interested' in re-signing United youngster Alejandro Garnacho.
Garnacho joined United from Atletico in September 2020 at the age of just 16-years-old. He has since developed at a rapid rate of knots, especially this season, becoming a familar figure in Erik ten Hag's plans in recent weeks.
He has made 15 senior appearances for the club, scoring two goals and grabbing four assists. The Reds remain determined to tie him down to a long-term contract.
United's next six fixtures
United continued their strong start ton 2023 with a 3-1 win over Everton in the FA Cup third-round on Friday night. Attention, however, has now switched to Tuesday night's Carabao Cup quarter-final against Charlton Athletic.
With that said, here is a quick glance at United's next six games:
- Charlton Athletic (H) - Carabao Cup Q/F - January 10
- Manchester City (H) - Premier League - January 14
- Arsenal (A) - Premier League - January 22
- TBC - FA Cup - Weekend of January 28
- Crystal Palace (H) - Premier League - February 4
- Leeds United (A) - Premier League - February 12
Ten Hag slams 'average' past transfers made by United
Erik ten Hag has described United's transfer business in recent years before his appointment as "average".
The Reds recruited well in the summer, signing Lisandro Martinez, Christian Eriksen, Tyrell Malacia, Casemiro and Antony. With the club having already spent £225million in the summer, Ten Hag is desperate to avoid the mistakes he witnessed the club making before his arrival.
He told Dutch outlet Voetbal International (via 90min):
"Manchester United didn't exactly have the fear factor last season. There was no spirit. I saw no team dynamic in the squad. The mental resilience was very low. I saw that as an outsider - and also noticed it in my first weeks at the club. I looked at the culture of the club. I asked: 'How did Manchester United become great?’ The club has bought an unimaginable number of players in recent years who have not been good enough. Most purchases have been average - and at United average is not good enough. United's shirt weighs heavily. Only real personalities, who can perform under great pressure, can play here."
